alert.note: Alert for Adams; Buffalo; Franklin; Hall; Kearney; Phelps (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Hastings (North Central Kansas and South Central Nebraska)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 21 at 4:30PM CDT by NWS Hastings
info.description: ...STRONG THUNDERSTORMS WILL IMPACT NORTHWESTERN FRANKLIN...EASTERN PHELPS...NORTHWESTERN ADAMS...KEARNEY...SOUTHEASTERN BUFFALO... NORTHEASTERN HARLAN AND SOUTHWESTERN HALL COUNTIES THROUGH 515 PM CDT... At 429 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Funk to near Hildreth to near Minden to Holstein. Movement was northeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to vegetation is possible. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Minden, Axtell, Roseland, Holstein, Funk, and Norman around 435 PM CDT. Heartwell around 445 PM CDT. This includes Interstate 80 between mile markers 262 and 279, and between mile markers 292 and 295. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 1000 PM CDT for a part of south central Nebraska.

area.areaDesc: Adams; Buffalo; Franklin; Hall; Kearney; Phelps
